column4: guys im loosing my mind here! ubuntu is refusing to load my network driver :( it says every time i boot up it says "this (blahblahblah) is not an 8139C+ compatible chip."  and "try the "8139too" driver instead " i have been googling etc for 3 hours now with no joy :(
Briefly, Ndiswrapper is a windows network driver, suited to work on Ubuntu
Have you tried blacklisting it in /etc/modprobe ?
Before making a thread you could try to "ask" google about "the chipset name" + "your Ubuntu version"
Try, under root "ifconfig" to see if your kernel shows up any net devices
I'd consider creating a thread on http://ubuntuforums.org
I'm sorry, i can't help you with that, I'm not good at hardware, sorry.
Let's not make it too big :)
I'm sure some Ubuntu dev or just more experienced user will help yoo out with that
Well, I'm assuming you've done that already :)
